pr_title: Adding a new Server API for computing average off heap memory consumed

timeline.message: Adding a new Server API for computing average off heap memory consumed

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to add it to MmapDebugResource?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: I don't have a strong preference. I put it here since this is at the table level whereas MmapDebugResource seems to be at the Server level. I'm fine either ways.
replies.author: icefury71

replies.bodyText:
If this is for debugging it should go into MmapDebugResource. If it is for building (say) a monitoring system, then it should be where you have put it.  On the other hand, for a monitoring system, you probably want to get the current memory used, for consuming/completed etc. segments, for one or all tables. Does that make sense?
Also, you mentioned that it will be useful for subsequent provisioning? I don't understand that part. If we are provisioning for the same table, then yes, it will be useful, but the table is already provisioned. If we are provisioning for another table that looks and feels like the same table (i.e. data characteristics are very similar or same), then it will be useful as well. Even in these cases, the provisioning story will be different depending on ingestion rate of the new table.
But for any other table with completely different characteristics, this data will be useless.
replies.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText:
It is meant more for a continuous monitoring system.
Good point about current memory: It probably makes more sense to get the latest size of the consuming segment for that table. Lemme add that as an additional endpoint.
replies.author: icefury71

replies.bodyText: In that case, do the existing metrics help? I am sure you already gave it a thought, but I am curious to know what is lacking.
replies.author: mcvsubbu
